alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:56AM EST until January 12 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CST FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CRITTENDEN...SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON...NORTHWESTERN CALDWELL AND NORTHWESTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 355 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Eddyville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Reports of up to goflball sized hail have been recieved with this storm and it remains capable of one and one half inch diameter hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Eddyville around 400 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Princeton, Farmersville and Creswell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 32 and 44. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 68 and 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
